intro: Arduina acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved arduina, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Arduina acuminata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
